"Hello Chaos, what do you mean what bothers me?" Tikal replied. She had no reason to feel anything but joy; she had Chaos, the chao, there was a beautiful waterfall basin she could visit, and the majesty of nature to explore, and above all else there was no war, no conflict. Tikal seemed to miss the emphasis Chaos placed on the word little and simply nodded her response, Chaos stared at her for several seconds before turning back towards the Master Emerald, "I shall see what I can do Tikal."

Chaos stared at the image before him his eyes scanning each person, the connection he had to the chaos force revealing everything about each individual his eyes fell upon. He cared for Tikal deeply, she was one of his few "friends" and he would not allow anyone who would even dare to think about harming her come to the island. Blaze growled as she raced after the robotic pirate captain in front of her, his occasional taunts only adding more fuel to her fire. An entire palace and its guard, dozens of rooms of traps, and still Captain Whiskers had somehow been able to steal the Jeweled Scepter, again! She had trusted 100 of her "elite" guard when they had asked her to take care of the scepter, an item of such value and power it could only be compared to the Sol emeralds themselves, and they had failed her. Blaze sighed as she spared a glance to the pouch at her side, the Sol Emeralds would always stay safe she would make sure of that.

"Argh, what be bothering ye lass?" Captain Whisker taunted "it weren't like ye actually expected those pitiful defences to keep me from me rightful booty did ye?" Blaze only growled her response, and urged herself to run faster, obviously Whisker had given himself a few upgrades since last they had met, he shouldn't have made it past the edge of the castle before she had captured him, but she had been giving chase for several minutes, and while she was gaining ground it was at a slow pace.

The chase continued for several more minutes before Blaze was able to corner Whisker's at the edge of a cliff. "Very good Lass" Whisker said tipping his hat to her "however I be the one wielding the Jeweled Scepter, and unlike last time ye don't have your little friends to help ye. Where be they by the way? Last I heard they up and skedaddled." Whisker meant for the simple taunt to confuse Blaze, however all it did was anger her.

"Friends, who needs friends?" The ferocity with which the words were spoken surprised even Whiskers. "Friends are those who say they care about you, but all they care about is themselves. They use you till they get what they want from you, they say that they'll visit, but you never see them again." Blaze's words became more and more personal as she spoke, each word being emphasized by a single step towards the Captain.

"N-Now, you better step back lass, I-I be the one wielding this here scepter, a-and if you don't step back I'll be sending all the islands straight down to Davy Jones Locker." These words prompted Blaze to stop, and Whiskers to speak words which would spell his doom. "Lassie, we all know that you can't beat me all on your lonesome, you're nothing without your friends." With these words, Whisker would swear he heard the sound of a rope snapping, out of the pouch on Blaze's side levitated seven emerald cut gems, the Sol emeralds. The 7 gems began to spin around Blaze before speeding towards her. In a blinding flash of light Blaze transformed into Burning Blaze, the sheer heat from the flames surrounding her causing Captain Whisker to take a step back.

"W-well Lassie, you have ol Cap'n Whiskers beat it seems, what say ye I just be given ya back this here scepter and we all can just go on our merry way?" Whiskers knew he was beat, but what he saw scared him, there was no mercy in her eyes, and while he had clashed with the lass before, this was the first time she had ever regarded him so coldly. Whiskers let go of the scepter and it fell to the ground, rolling till it reached Blaze's feet, however she ignored it. Slowly she took a step forward and he took one back, this pattern continued till he was standing just on the edge of the cliff. "Al-alright lass, this be not funny anymore ol Cap'n Whisker is sorry, so I think it be time to be hauling me away."

"Say it" Blaze's voice was cold, something Captain Whisker had never heard, sure he knew she was supposed to be the stoic guardian of the Sol Emeralds, but there was usually some emotion to her voice, usually anger as she chased after him but there was none in her voice now.

"S-Say what lass? Ye be making no sense." Captain Whisker honestly thought about jumping off the cliff, however being a robot with no aquatic subsystems, he would be the one sinking to Davy Jones Locker if he fell off that cliff, and that wasn't something he was hoping to do.

"Say that I'm just fine without any friends and I don't need them" Captain Whisker winced at the renewed anger in Blaze's voice, but he wasn't exactly going to go against her, not when he was stuck between her and a drop off a cliff.

"A-Aye lass, ye beat me fair and square all on your lonesome, ye don't have any need for friends, and you’re just fine without them." Blaze's eyes narrowed for a second as she regarded the captain, with a nod of her head she turned, picked up the scepter, and took off back to the castle. It only took her a minute to return to her room in the castle, with a sigh she held the scepter in her hands, contemplating the power it had yet for all that power it couldn't give her what she wanted. Images of the adventures she had shared with Sonic and his friends appeared in her mind, Sonic and Tails had even come to the Sol dimension once, and they had again fought as allies. That had been a long time ago, and she hadn't heard anything or received even a visit from Sonic and his friends. Tails and Sonic had returned home, and she had used the power of the Sol Emeralds to visit Sonic's dimension for his birthday one year, so she knew it was possible to travel dimensions, relatively easily in her opinion.

"Am I really that unimportant, I thought I was a good friend, and I thought they were my friends, they helped me retrieve the Sol Emeralds rather than steal them, and Sonic and Tails aided me in retrieving the Jeweled Scepter. So why does it seem like they've forgotten me?" Blaze hated this feeling, she had opened her heart so that she could make friends, but all it had allowed was for them to hurt her. "I-I just want a true friend, is that so much to ask for, someone who would actually be there for me?" Blaze was on the edge of tears by the end, while she hadn't let it show Whisker's taunts had hurt her deeply. Staring again at the scepter she sighed before placing it under her pillow, " I might as well go tell the guard that I've returned the scepter, and that it stays with me from now on." With that Blaze walked out of the room, this absence meaning she missed the glow that began to emanate from under her pillow, the Jeweled Scepter activating at Blaze’s heartfelt plea.

She was finally able to speak as she saw that two-tailed fox pal of Sonic's walk up to him, hidden behind his back was a small pair of pliers.

"That fox, he disarmed the bomb" she growled, she was about to go and give that rat a piece of her mind before Jet stopped her, shaking his head, the three Rouges walked up to Sonic and his friends, Jet plastered the biggest, fakest smile Wave had ever seen on his face before making to shake Sonic's hand.

"Congratulations buddy, guess the better racer won" The venom in Jet's voice was enough to make a cobra jealous, Sonic only smiled and nodded back at Jet, making his way towards the emeralds. Jet suddenly ran past him, holding up the key of Babylon, before anyone knew what was happening, the Chaos Emerald's floated into the air, striking the key with a beam of light before the key activated, raising Babylon Gardens from its burial place beneath the sands. Wave watched Jet stand there triumphantly, before a claw came out of nowhere and snatched the key out of Jet's hands.

"Ohohohoho" Eggman laughed as his eggmoble held the Key of Babylon in its pincer, "now the treasure of Babylon is al mine" he cried before taking off for the ruins, Amy Rose somehow jumping on the back of his craft. Wave ran up to Jet and was about to take off after Eggman before Jet's arm blocked her.

"Where do you think you're going?" Jet's voice was cold, something Wave had never heard before.

"To the Babylon Gardens of course, to claim the treasure our ancestors left us" Wave replied her voice a mix of excitement, trepidation and fear.

"The treasure was left for the Babylonians, you lost the right to call yourself that the minute you failed" Jet replied. "Come on Storm, we have a treasure to claim" and with that Jet and Storm took off after Eggman, Sonic and his friends having already left to chase the doctor. Wave could only stare there slackjawed for several moments, unable to comprehend what was happening, she had worked all her life to unearth the treasure of Babylon, Jet and Storm always at her side, they had been a trio, and they had just cast her aside like a tool, like one of her wrenches.

Wave jumped on her extreme gear and took off back to their private airship, she spent a long time, several hours in fact cooped up in her room before she finally was able to pull herself together. With a determined smirk on her lips she started up the ship's cloaking field and made her way to the Babylon Gardens, Jet and Storm didn't want her as a Babylon Rouge anymore, fine she was alright with that. The airship was hers now, and any treasure she was sure her former partners missed would be quite valuable, neither of them were really that observant, they'd miss a pile o gold coins if it was sitting on a big altar waiting to be taken.

Wave took a few hours and searched every nook and cranny before heading for what was the obvious treasure room hoping to find something, sadly there was nothing, as she entered the main treasure room she could do naught but let out a shriek, as the room was empty, from only smooth stone walls, ceiling and floors met her gaze. With a sob she collapsed against one of the walls, there was nothing, nothing, all tis time, all those years wasted. Wave however didn't notice the slight motion of the wall she was leaning against until it moved, swinging inward, Wave falling backwards and landing on the top step of a narrow spiral staircase. 'What's this?' the thought echoed through her head, with a shrug she descended the steps.

She descended the steps for several minutes, strangely even though she had descended paste light provided by the door after several seconds she found herself able to easily navigate the steps. Down into the depths of the gardens Wave went, when the steps finally ended she was in a long hallway leading up to an altar, atop the altar was a large arch made out of metal, honestly it looked kind of like a gateway some form of control panel sitting near it. Walking forward she tapped one of the keys tentatively, a large holographic screen appearing before her. There she saw what the device was, and all she could do was scoff "dimensional relocate pfft, yeah right" she thought as she tapped through the options for the apparent 'dimensional portal'. "So what do we have here? Location of entry, location of exit...size of object? Even if this does what it says it does why would the Babylonians need something like that. Why do they have technology that seems like its thousands of years ahead of what we have?" Wave thought to herself as she keyed in a bit of information.

Wave sighed before smiling "this seems to be the real treasure of Babylon, so let's see whether this thing really works or not. Location of Entry, hmm" she thought for a few seconds before putting in a random location, what she didn't notice was on top of the usual x, y, and z values there was also a 4th value. This 4th value was the dimensional value, and at the moment it wasn't set for Mobius. "Hmm, well let's see location of exit, it should probably be somewhere on the ship, but where should I put whatever I get the cargo hold? My room? Hmm" Wave spent a few minutes in thought before finally deciding on where she wanted whatever was going to come through to show up then inputting the location in. "Now all I have to pick is a size, well obviously I don't want it to be too small as I want to actually be able to notice it, but what if I pull something alive through." That thought gave her pause for a few seconds mainly about actually using the device that stood before her "I'm sure if I pull anything through it'll be like a squirrel or something. 4 inches should be small enough" with a satisfied smirk she typed in the value and stared at the activation key. "Now or never" she thought before hitting it. With a loud groan underneath her she heard...something activating before the portal in front of her flared into life.

Wave was no coward but she'd admit she took a few steps back as a swirling purple vortex filled the gateway. She saw some sort of pinprick at the centre of the portal for a fraction of a second before it disappeared in a flash of light, with a loud whine the machine suddenly fell silent, the "portal" collapsing in on itself before disappearing. "D-Did it work?" she thought, a hint of trepidation about using that device entering her thoughts as she walked up to the console and tried to reactivate it. "Guess that last use must have fried the circuits, or drained it. I can't imagine sitting in the ground for millennia has done this place much good" she thought. With a shrug she turned around and headed back to the airship, she knew exactly where she had sent whatever had come through, if something had come through, and she planned to find it and see if this thing was legit or not, if it was...then it was a shame that it seemed to be fried.

Wave couldn't help the quick pace she maintained after she re-entered her airship. while whatever that machine would have spit out would only be a few inches tall it was the only treasure her people would have left her. Centuries of history, and it wouldn't be going too far to say her whole life culminated in seeing what awaited her on top of her dresser. She froze a few feet in front of the door to her bedroom, took in a big breath, released it and calmed down.

Slowly opening the door she walked into the room. As she entered years of practice looking over the most minute components told her everything seemed to be in order, her queen-size bed still lay in the center of the room as well as her nightstand, no damage had been done to the large wardrobe on the right wall, and the door to her ensuite bathroom was in the exact same position it had been when she left. Turning to face her vanity she saw something sitting in the center of the darkened wood, it looked like a human, only shrunken down to 4 inches exact. She couldn't let on that she had noticed what she assumed to be a guy as there were no breasts, looking over her new shrunken companion she admired herself in the mirror and inwardly cringed. Searching the ruins had left near every inch of her dusty and dirty and while she would be considered a tomboy, as she had grease stains coating nearly her whole body more times than she could count, she still took pride in her appearance.

Inwardly sighing she turned and headed towards her ensuite bathroom, her new little friend wouldn't be going anywhere soon, the vanity was too high and there was nothing on it that could help him get down, with a satisfied smirk crossing her features she closed her bathroom door and got ready for a long, and in her mind well-deserved hot shower.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- --------

He couldn't help but jump as the gigantic door that lay across the expanse of the room in front of him closed, the difference in size making the simple sound echo like a thunderclap. What, or rather who he had just seen he had no idea, she and he knew it was a girl due to the small but still noticeable breasts that pressed against her tight top. She seemed to be some kind of bird-woman as she had a beak, although she had purple fur that was so fine it looked almost like skin, her leaning over had given him a very close look at her. The giant bird-woman could maybe be his way out, or his way home but first he had to figure his way off of, whatever it was he was on.

Looking around he was able to see several items that looked like beauty products, and the fact that there was a large mirror behind him led him t deduce he was on top of a vanity, although this information did him little good other than telling him he could still recognize items at his diminutive size. Spending a few moments to look around, he was startled as the sound of running water started up, she was taking a shower, if she was like most women that gave him a few minutes to figure something out. Quickly running from one corner of the vanity to the other he couldn't see anything he could use to get down, sighing he laid back against what seemed to be a compress, there was nothing he could do until the bird-woman finished her shower...

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ---------

Sighing Wave stepped out of the shower, hot steam filling the room "took longer than I thought" she muttered, then shrugged it wasn't like Jet or Storm would get mad at her for using all the hot water anymore, and at the moment she didn't have any treasure she was planning to steal so there weren't any deadlines to fill she could be a bit indulgent. Taking a few moments to dry off as her body really liked to retain water after she bathed, she exited the bathroom and humming happily waked over towards her wardrobe. Taking a moment to decide she chose a simple pair of white pajamas before letting the towel fall to the floor, she took her time getting dressed making sure each movement was pronounced and noticed. Wave didn't forget that her little guest was there, and in fact she could feel his gaze on her body, surprisingly she was enjoying the feeling of him watching. It was naughty Wave knew that, but she was the one in complete control. She decided how much he saw and whether his little show ended. In a few moments she finished placing her pajamas on yet her little companion's gaze never left her body as she turned and walked up to the vanity, taking a seat she grabbed a brush and began to brush out her hair into its iconic twin trail style.

She could honestly keep the game of not knowing he was there going for a while, but she was a treasure hunter not some cruel tyrant, letting out a sigh she looked down at the vanity "where did I put..." surprising even her the micro was right under her face, so her eyes fell near instantly on him. She couldn't help but pull back, as did he and she simply stared at him for a few seconds before lowering her head and really examining him. She noticed small things about him that she couldn't at a distance. He was wearing a black t-shirt, khaki shorts, and he was even wearing small sneakers and socks, his eyes stared up at her and she saw several emotions in them, confuse, trepidation, and a hint of fear characterizing his gaze but there was a hint of curiosity and awe as well.

"H...Hi" Wave's eyes widened as she saw her diminutive companion speak, his mouth opening as if to shout although it sounded like little more than normal room level speech to her. Wave couldn't help but smirk a bit, this little guy had a lot of guts to start up the conversation, given their difference in size.

"Hello" Wave replied, she had to take a second to decide just what she wanted to do with her diminutive shipmate, she didn't have any jobs even those requiring precision that she'd need a second pair of hands with, although he might be quite useful to get through cracks when treasure hunting, "assistant" worked quite well in her eyes, besides she could always just have him take care of her if nothing else.

"What are you doing in my home?" she asked, there wasn't any malice behind the words, but there was definite authority. She couldn't help but giggle internally as she saw him freeze for a second and try to come up with a response.

"I...I don't honestly know" he replied honestly, while he knew the answer would seem inadequate, he had no other "I was just laying down and then I found myself...here" he emphasized his point by sweeping his arms across the expanse of the room.

"Hmm..." Wave pretended to ponder his answer, although it sounded about right, given that he had been teleported to her room rather than confirm or deny him she decided to have a little fun. "While I was changing it felt like there was someone watching me, you wouldn't happen to know about that would you?" Her question ending with a slight coo, she knew that he'd make excuse after excuse and that was all the justification she needed to start the ball rolling.

"Y...yes I did, I'm sorry" his voice was barely audible and characterized by regret and remorse.

Wave swore she heard a record scratch in her head "W...wait what did you just say?" she asked leaning over him.

"I...I watched you change, I'm sorry but you just looked so beautiful..." He trailed off and Wave could only stare at him for a few seconds, no way was she expecting him to fess up and to compliment her as well.

A sigh escaped Sally Acorn’s lips as she walked around Mobotropolis, despite the drafty nature of her attire, black shorts with white trimming, a black crop-top with a light blue vest atop it, dark blue boots with white outlines along the buckles and white gloves she was warm as the sun’s warm gentle rays beat down upon her. Looking out over the kingdom of Mobotropolis from one of Castle Acorn’s numerous turrets she tried to remember a time when they had not been at war with Doctor Eggman. Unable to recall a time since her early youth she felt a shiver run through her body. Knothole was safe as it should be, as was her own kingdom, Doctor Eggman had not unleashed a single attack, attempted roboticization, or raid for several days. That did not mean that he still was not out there, as she would not trust any report that the megalomaniac was defeated and out of the picture until she had him standing before him preferably with every extremity lashed and shackled. As she thought about all the pain that monster had caused her personally, the unfathomable suffering he had caused the people of her kingdom and the world at large.

Sonic himself had reported that Eggman was no more, one of his latest death-dealing machines having exploded before the tyrant could escape when Sonic defeated him. At least that was what the hedgehog believed, moments before the machine had exploded the facility they had been battling in had begun to collapse and Sonic just escaped, a backdraft wave following him out the building, moments later the entire structure collapsed. There had been no activity for several days, scouts were searching every inch of Robotropolis but there was still no sign of Eggman. She could not help but have this bad feeling about the whole thing, though Sonic had suffered several close calls over the years, even she had suffered one or two brushes with death Eggman had this nasty tendency of presumably dying only to come back stronger than ever. She did not want to believe that the war would start again, she wanted for it just be over with all her heart but she was not holding her breath. Sighing she glanced up at the blue sky, the white fluffy clouds, it was a beautiful day, not one to be spent indoors moping around about what might be, brooding about the most cynical and paranoid outcomes when her kingdom knew a peace false though it may be, short though it may be that they had not known in years. Leaving the tower she quickly navigated the intricate maze of halls passages, and corridors as well as the numerous interconnecting rooms that made up the interior of Castle Acorn until she arrived at the great throne room. There sitting on his throne was her father, for just a moment there was a phantom image of another throne, and another figure, a woman seated next to her father but in an instant, it was gone.

“Sally, is there something wrong my dear?” King Maximillian asked his daughter, standing from the throne he was surprised to find her in the throne room. Normally when she came to him, it was to alert him of some trouble. “Is Doctor Eggman back?” He asked, the barest hint of fear entering his voice.

“No, no he’s, he’s still missing. I just came to let you know that I’d be out in the village” Sally replied, as she walked up to her father, her hands rising in a placating gesture as the ape guards began to look around warily at the mere mention of Eggman.

“Sally, my dear you’ve fought a war against Julian and Walter at completely separate times while I’ve been trapped. For years you led the people instead of me, destroying factories, facing down armies, monsters, anything and everything that could or would dare threaten our kingdom and Mobius as a whole and I’m not supposed to trust that you can visit the Mobotroplolis proper or Knothole by yourself?” Despite his words there was a jovial, teasing tone to King Max’s voice, one eyebrow raising as he looked at his daughter.

“I have been kidnapped a few times too Dad” Sally replied abashedly, turning away and rubbing at her wrist in embarrassment “and with Mom gone we’re all each other has,” Sally finished.

“I appreciate the concern Sally” King Max replied, as he strode across the throne room to embrace her. “But you are one of if not the most competent women on the planet, you’ve faced a fair number of hardships and though I’m your father you don’t need to come to me for everything. I trust you and your judgement, especially on whether you can go out on such a beautiful day as today. Frankly, if I didn’t have court to attend to I just might join you”

“Thank you” Sally replied, giving her father a quick peck on the cheek and a gentle but quick hug. With that Sally ran out of the throne room, racing down into Mobotropolis proper she was still a little surprised that the city despite Eggman’s numerous attacks, the legions of badniks, hordes, of Swatbots, and a Death Egg or two had survived relatively unscathed. As she walked around the village she was greeted by numerous sights and smells; the scent of freshly baked bread, children scampering back and forth around their parents as they played with each other and friends, a pair of lovebirds exchanging sweet nothings as they walked hand in hand. Smiling she felt a gentle warmth suffused her body, this was what she fought against Robotnik for so that her people could have these moments, enjoy a peace and security she was denied during her own childhood. Every citizen that saw her gave her at least a small bow, some of the most conservative residents of the village bowing to one knee or curtsying so low the hems of their clothes touched the dirt.

She tried to wave the royal treatment off but was quickly rebuffed by several citizens “it’s not just that you’re the princess, you and the rest of the Freedom Fighters have saved all our lives dozens of times, the least we can do is show you the proper respect.” That comment would have brought a bright flaring blush to Sally’s cheeks if her fur did not get in the way; setting off after the minor interruption she passed a small alley when she heard something.

“Princess, Princess Sally, come here,” a voice from the alley called. Looking around Sally hesitated for a moment before her father’s words came to mind, she was more than just the princess she was a freedom fighter. Even if there was someone waiting to ambush her, she could protect herself. Walking into the dark, dingy alley, she was surprised to find it very quickly opening into a small open space, several lanterns filling the area with light as the buildings surrounding the little space cast it into shadow. As she looked around the entire place, it was painfully barren except for a simple table facing the alley she had just come from. Spread across its length were numerous machines, just as strange as the machines themselves were the person standing on the other side of the table. A lanky overlander, standing far above herself stood there in a full suit, pearly white teeth were revealed as the man’s lips split into a wide grin. “I am so happy that you decided to take up my offer to visit my little store Princess, browse as you please”

There was Antoine falling before her, just out of reach, nothing she could do. Time seemed to stop as Eggman spoke the word that would devastate not only her husband but her whole world “detonate.” What froze Bunnie’s blood wasn’t the paralyzing light, the searing heat, or the chunks of metal now scattered across the forest floor. It was the unmoving form of her husband lying there, his body covered in terrible burns down to the bone in some places.

“ANTOINE!!!”

Bunnie bolted awake, a cold sweat covering her entire body as the same vivid memory, her own personal nightmare replayed through her mind once again. It had been months since she’d moved away from Knothole, abandoning her duty and leaving Antoine behind. Getting rid of her robotics was a dream come true, she could be normal, she could…raise a family. The thought brought a brief smile to her face as the crushing weight of reality fell back upon her. She was nearly useless to the resistance now, her robotics, her curse had been what allowed her to protect those she cared about. Looking back they’d allowed her to help and protect so many. “Now, ah’m not good for much other than as a vegetable farmer.” Her voice was characterized by pain, she wanted so badly to undo her mistakes, she’d even be willing to be re-roboticized but nothing would be able to change the past, nothing could undo the pain caused by the fulfillment of her selfish wish.

Getting up slowly, she reached for her hat, sitting atop her small bedside table Bunnie made her way through her modest home. A short hallway connected her bedroom to the rest of the home. Making her way quickly through the home and out the front door out onto her home’s modest porch a gentle breeze stirred up blowing through Bunnie’s sweat stained fur and hair. She didn't even notice the nightmare caused her to be drenched in sweat.

Gazing out over the modest oasis she now called home, one of the few sanctuaries of the Great Dessert and Mobius as a whole. Slowly she let her eyes lift to the stars above her, the ephemeral dots of light strangely comforting the scarred fighter.

“Please, if ah’ve done anything right with mah life, all ah want is to be able to do is protect someone again. Ah already failed mah Antoine, and…” Bunnie’s voice slowly trailed off. This last nightmare had been the last straw for the poor drained bunny and even as she tried to continue speaking her words slowly devolved into subdued sobs that quickly turned into a keen wail as Bunnie thought about all she’d lost, and in her own mind it was all her fault. She wasn’t sure how long she stood outside her home sobbing into the darkness, but eventually the tears stopped flowing. Her body simply too exhausted to produce anymore tears rather than her sorrow leaving her. Bunnie turned and slowly trudged back into her home. Taking a minute to walk through her home she crawled back into bed and thankfully sleep quickly reclaimed Bunnie, in part due to the emotional exhaustion she was suffering. Unbeknownst to Bunnie, ever since she had looked to the skies and made her heartfelt plea, several stars had begun to glow brighter and brighter before vanishing completely from the night sky off to fulfill the duty entrusted to them, to bring Bunnie someone to protect and love.

Bunnie gently yawned as she stirred from her fitful slumber, her eyes stuck fast as she tried to open them. Dried tears from the night before held her emerald orbs shut for a moment until she forced them open, Bunnie having to wipe at her eyes to clear them a moment later. Yawning she realized that much more than her eyes had been affected by her late-night excursion, her fur tear-stained and clinging to her body thanks to last night’s emotional release.

Getting out of bed she headed for her bedroom’s adjoining bath, the small room large enough to hold her more than adequate bathtub, a toilet, as well as a small vanity and mirror. Taking a moment to examine herself in the mirror she was a little shocked at how she looked even though she wasn’t usually a girl for primping and preening, that’s how bad it was. Of specific note were her ears drooping behind her as well as her matted and generally messy fur.

Slowly Bunnie stripped out of her pajamas, the soft silken garments falling to the tiled bathroom floor with a soft “thump”. Stepping into the bathtub and shutting the curtain behind her, Bunnie started up the water “I really need this” she muttered tiredly. Yet as the hot water struck her exhausted body, new life seemed to flow into her, her body awakening as all the physical if not emotional stains were slowly cleansed from her by the beating droplets of warm water. “Ahhh” the gentle sigh was one of peace, Bunnie knew she’d have to eventually confront the events of the prior night, as this was an event she couldn’t just ignore, but now wasn’t the time for that. Leaning over she grabbed a bottle of fur-wash and after making sure a loofah was heavily coated, began to wash away what the water couldn’t. In a matter of minutes the bathroom was filled with steam and the barest hint of lavender as Bunnie thoroughly cleaned from the tips of her lop-ears to the pads of her feet. Moving on Bunnie undid the braid holding her hair up, her long tresses cascading down over her shoulders and back in a golden waterfall. Focusing her attention on the freed locks Bunnie spent nearly a full minute washing and conditioning it, as while she was sure she’d be getting dirty in the next several hours there was just something gross about having her hair dirty and clammy even if most of it was kept under her Stetson. Feeling refreshed and cleansed Bunnie turned off the water and stepped out of the bathtub, taking a good half-minute to examine herself in the mirror. Gone was most of the evidence of the previous night’s events, now Bunnie’s fur and hair shined in even the soft mornings light, gone was the doubt and sadness she’d felt before…atleast on the outside.

Confidently Bunnie walked back into her room, and after a minute of choosing her outfit…not that she had the greatest selection to begin with. It only took a few seconds to don a light blue underwear set, her usual pink jumpsuit, leather jacket and gloves “now where’s mah hat…” she muttered before spotting it lying where she’d left it, on her bedside table. Walking over she was just about to grab it when she noticed something…strange, there was something nestled in the groove in the top of her hat. Slowly reaching forward and gently lifting the hat as slowly and quietly as she could Bunnie brought the hat as close as she could to her face.

“Well I’ll be…” she muttered

Something was wrong; Michael knew that much as he ran through the dreamscape, as a strange warmth seemed to surround every inch of his body as his legs carried him through the ink black landscape. Yet despite the comforting feeling from this warmth there was an even greater feeling, of a great weight looming over him, about to crush him. He could feel it growing closer and closer until “AHHHH” he woke up screaming, his eyes jumping from side to side as he looked around and very nearly screamed again. He was surrounded on all sides by horizontal golden-brown pillars covered in fur. Eyes following the pillars the colour shifted instantly from brown to pink, the different colour drawing his attention and his gaze upward, up past the two perfectly round orbs jutting out of the pink, up past another field of golden-brown to…a face. With the admittance that he was looking up at a face, albeit one that looked very rabbit-like compared to the usual human face, a small fear was confirmed in his mind…he was looking at a giant humanoid female specifically one that was at least part rabbit. Her emerald eyes focusing down upon him as her small pink nose seemed to almost twitch in excitement as a small smile graced her features. Before he could even think of moving one of her hands was beneath him, and he was carefully but quickly brought to her face. She opened her mouth as if to talk and…

“What do you want from me?!” Michael had tried his hardest but he couldn’t help the outburst. The giant rabbit woman paused for a moment, he was about to repeat his question when he was suddenly lowered back down to where he’d been before and her legs began to move as she changed position so she was spread across the bed before him staring down at him, head in her hands rather than surrounding him on all sides with her legs.
“Better Sugar?” She asked, and while Michael was still freaking out, the fact he actually had space to move calmed him, if only slightly.

“Y-yeah, now answer my question” He continued in as commanding a tone as he could muster, he knew he wasn’t in control here, but the illusion of some sort of control was comforting.

“Ah don’t know why you’re here” her reply was characterized by what almost seemed like regret for her answer “ah was hoping you’d know what was happening and ah could get a few answers from you, but ah guess that’s not happening huh?” She chuckled at the end of her sentence and while he was sure it was for his benefit more than anything else he stepped backwards unable to really accept what was happening.

“Thump” He had been paying so much attention he hadn’t even realized her left arm had reached over him and was now preventing him from moving any further as his back pressed against the solid wall of flesh. Wheeling around, ignoring every instinct that said he shouldn’t give the giantess his back he was about to bolt before her right arm came down meeting with her left sealing off any exit he had. Suddenly the rabbit woman began to pull her arms back towards her; bracing himself to be smashed against her cheek Michael was surprised to find rather than crushing force he was surrounded by the same gentle warmth as in his dream as she gently rubbed her cheek against him.

“Ah’m not sure why you’re here, but ah promise ah’m not here to hurt you” she spoke sincerely or at the very least was very good at acting. Turning to face the giantess he was met with a soft smile barely a foot from him, although the rabbit woman quickly pulled her face back. “Ah’m Bunnie, Bunnie Rabbot, and you are?”

“Michael, Michael Phelps” he replied hesitantly. Not like telling her his name really mattered, but he never knew.

“It’s a pleasure to meet ya Michael” Bunnie replied cheerily, “now ah’m feeling a mite bit peckish as ah haven’t eaten yet, would yah like some breakfast?” Now that he wasn’t freaking out over the situation it was quite surprising to Michael that Bunnie wasn’t questioning what was happening as much as he was, then again she was the larger one, and he didn’t think he’d be exactly worried if the roles were reversed in fact he’d be pretty curious if a tiny rabbit woman appeared in his room.

“Ummm…yeah, food, food sounds good” He replied softly.

“Good, ya don’t mind if I pick ya up do ya?” Bunnie asked her legs flying above him as she slowly sat up, her form towering over him.

“Depends what you want to do with me?” He replied chuckling and trying to pass over the answer as a joke but being completely serious.

“Oh, I just want to put ya in my pocket” Bunnie replied opening a breast pocket on her leather jacket. “I just don’t have very many places to carry ya in, and I didn’t think ya’d want to just sit in my palm.”

“The pocket works fine” Michael replied more quickly than he’d intended, yet this seemed to only draw a giggle from Bunnie as she suddenly reached forward, her fingers closing on the back of his shirt with surprisingly little force yet extreme dexterity. Slowly he was lifted from the bed, and above her right front pocket, rather than letting him drop however Bunnie took the extra time and care to place him in the rather spacious pouch.

“Let’s go get some breakfast” With those words and a pat to his pocket Bunnie began to walk through her home. Yet this pat made something very clear to Michael, namely that he was in a “breast” pocket, as Bunnie’s pat was enough to press him against the soft warm orb his pocket backed onto. This contact making him acutely aware of how he was separated from a breast larger than his entire body by only a comparative inch or so of fabrics, this realization causing his cheeks to flush profusely. Slowly Bunnie got up and began to walk through her home…

Nicole was…confused, for lack of a better term, as she walked through the expansive emptiness that was the digital world. Someplace isolated for her to go when things became too hectic or when she needed time to think like now. Sighing she slumped against one of the world’s digital trees, the green flora just resembling the real-life plant it was supposed to represent. Holding up one gloved hand, slowly the blacktopped, white-bottomed glove faded away revealing a slender brown hand. Flexing and unflexing her fingers she had to wonder just how real she was the truth revealed to her after revealing Dr.Ellidy had left her in a state of shock and for a while panic had overwhelmed her systems…her body. Shaking her head and groaning Nicole pulled her legs close together, she was not supposed to be this emotional though she did not want to go back to the logic-ruled machine she once was having feeling like this was….complicated.

“What am I?” Nicole muttered, her own holo-form, the presence of the digitizer one of Eliidy’s greatest inventions, which could digitize an individual’s mind, everything just made her question just how real she was. Was she no different from any other Mobian? She could feel, laugh, and as her present circumstances dictated feel stressed or anxious, but she was “born” as a computer program nothing more than... Nicole’s thoughts trailed off as she thought about her “purpose” within life. Always she had been acting in relation to another, with Dr.Ellidy and as loathe as she was to admit it, with Sally. She did not begrudge her friend, she was only a little girl when the two of them had first met and Sally was one of the reasons she had so desired, evolved to be more than just what she was. Yet she still acted only in relation to her friend, aiding the Freedom Fighters was a noble goal, they were acting to restore the whole world from the destruction Eggman had wrought and yet there had to be more to life? If there was more to life, than what was it? She was connected to the Royal Archive, so as she was wont to do she went searching through the vast repository of information, thousands of books worth of info, lifetimes of knowledge flowed through her in an instant as she searched desperately for that which so eluded her. As she finished her search a sigh escaped her soft gentle lips, there was no consensus on what the reason for life was, reasons ranging from money, to power, to the selfless sacrifice for another. There was a greater consensus on the more altruistic reasons, to help others, self-sacrifice, and of course love. Love, she had observed the emotion displayed by several of her teammates, Amy expressed it for Sonic, Sonic and Sally seemed to express it for each other though they seemed to attempt to hide the emotion. It was especially present in the actions between Antoine and Bunnie and yet despite multiple viewings of the emotion from several of her most trusted friends she still did not understand the emotion.

Standing up, she gazed up at the pale green sky of the Digital world, pixelated clouds outlined by dark lines of green floating overhead as the world attempted to simulate reality to some degree. Shaking her head she walked further and further into uncharted territory, though she knew Phage was out there somewhere, the malicious viral entity, a construct of Dr.Eggman she was fairly confident she was safe. She could return to her terminal at any time, and the Red Star Ring leant to her and the other Freedom Fighters by Dr.Ellidy now stayed permanently attached to her console. She could “overclock” as Sally had described the process, whenever she wished. Even without the power boost waiting in the wings the digital world was as large if not larger than the real Mobius, Phage would never find her even if it came looking, after their first encounter she had no intentions of meeting the entity again and had set up every personal firewall, and protection program she could not be tracked. Kilometer after virtual kilometer fell away beneath her paws as she walked, though the digital world had never seemed beautiful to her before she had gained a new insight into life and now looked on it with some awe. How such a massive program could have been built was beyond her, and in fact, no one on Mobius knew where the Digital World had come from. It already existed when Mobians first learned to access it, Rotor once describing it to her as “a global system of interconnected networks” though as far as anyone could tell the networks the Digital world had been connected to no longer existed yet it still remained.

As she walked the Digital world around her began to change as he forced some of her will on the landscape, gone were the plain green textures that outlined everything, spreading out from her the Digital World became “alive” for lack of a better term. “Grass” sprouting from the simulated ground, the sky above her changing to a pale azure rather than the digital green, the clouds lightening to soft white shapes, which flowed and changed as a gentle ephemeral breeze wafted over her blowing the lynx’s shoulder length black hair up and into her face. Nicole having to spit out the troublesome strands, tough she was annoyed for a second she could not help but laugh the unintended consequence of the wind, “chaos” one of the few things that separated the real from the digital. She had not intended such a thing but she was heartened by its occurrence, despite being a digital being she was not bothered by the unexpected. Smiling she watched as the area grew, stopping as it reached about a thirty-foot radius around her, she set off. Nicole watched with fascination as the area before her, which was once just barren pixels or items, which were at best caricatures of what they were supposed to represent change as she approached, and fade back to the way they had been as he moved away. It was as if the entire digital world was just lying in hibernation, waiting for someone to make use of it, she had to wonder just how much of an influence she had over the digital world. She had been able to affect it in some ways before, creating physical objects or weapons but never in such a way as she was now. ‘Is this a result of learning where I came from, or has some other variable been introduced into the digital world’ Nicole pondered for several seconds until a sudden shout appeared from out of the blue “help!”

Raising her head, Nicole was not able to pinpoint the direction of the sound immediately but after several seconds of searching, she found there was another presence in the digital world, though she could not get a precise lock on it, it was as if it was not even a digital entity. Confused by the sudden intrusion yet curious at the same time she knew she had to investigate. “I’ll just go tell Sally and the rest of the Freedom Fighters…” Nicole trailed off as she realized what she was doing. She was as much a Freedom Fighter as anyone else and she did not need anyone’s permission to do anything. If she got into trouble, she always had her overclocked form, and if the very worst should happen, she could always return to her handheld. Pausing she waited several seconds to confirm that the signal as strange as it was, was not Phage, getting a negative reading to the Doctor’s malicious entity she set off in the direction the shout had come from. Moments later, another shout of “help” reached her ears; thankfully, it came from the same direction, the shout louder though not by much, speeding up Nicole could not help but smile.

This was the Digital world; whatever she willed could happen here, and as she wanted to reach whom or whatever was calling for aid quickly her legs slowly began to spin, gaining momentum as she took on Sonic’s speed. Blasting across the digital landscape she almost missed the next call, as she had naturally assumed that there would be wind when Sonic moves, she barely heard the next shout over the roaring of the wind. Analyzing the shout, they were fairly even in timber, loud and clear with no signs of pause or impediment, so the shouter was not in any pain though there was a clear sense of anxiety and confusion emphasized by the pitch of the shout, whoever was yelling did not seem to know that they were in the digital world.

‘That’s strange’ Nicole thought as she raced across the digital landscape, the only way she knew to enter the digital world was if someone was hooked up to a Digitizer like Dr.Ellidy had created. As far as she knew the one Dr.Ellidy had was the only one of its kind, unless Phage had somehow been able to steal the plans for the device! She did not know what Dr.Eggman would do with such a device, but whatever it was, if the criminal mastermind had somehow gotten his hands on the plans for the Digitizer then some poor soul, might be lost within the Digital World. She would not say she was the “guardian” of the Digital World, but as she was the most knowledgeable member of the Freedom Fighters about its usage and in fact the only one who could freely enter it she felt a certain responsibility. Speeding up she became little more than a blur of light, streaking across the landscape the next cry came from right in front of her. Instinctively Nicole jumped; her momentum carrying her straight up, the height she gained would normally have been daunting to anyone but the holo-lynx, who simply descended gently, a purple aura of energy surrounding her as she landed gently upon the digital landscape. Looking around she could not see anything until she heard something below and slightly in front of her. Looking down Nicole quickly stepped back though she was careful to watch her step, one gloved hand gently covering her mouth as she saw…

He could chance the jump, but that seemed more like a desperation move than one he’d like to take at the moment.

Looking back the only option he had was to wake the titanic canine woman, or simply hide, the only real hiding place he had was the unused pillow but that seemed as good a place as any, he had theoretically been sleeping on this woman, for how long he didn't know but just the fact he was able to do so said she didn't move in her sleep...probably. Walking over to the pillow he now had to decide whether to hide under it, or on it, both had obvious pros and cons, the most readily being whether he wanted to be spotted or not. Taking a few seconds to think, hiding under the pillow seemed like the better option, he wanted the meeting that was inevitably going to happen be as much in his control as possible, it was the only way he saw himself surviving.

Taking a moment to judge the weight of the pillow he found it wasn't that heavy, it only felt like he threw a 50 pound sandbag on his back, rather than the potentially crushing force he was expecting, shimmying further under the pillow he turned so just his head was sticking out, the remained of the pillow acting as a giant blanket would. Slowly the weight became more comfortable by the second, combined with the warmth given off by his body and the surprisingly soothing rhythm of the canine woman's breathing he fell into a deep sleep.

He was violently jerked out of his sleep as the pillow that lay atop him was removed 'oh shit' was the first thought that entered his mind, however after a few moments of...admitted cowering, he looked up to see the woman hugging the pillow against herself. He couldn't help but let out a nervous chuckle, as he thought his cover had been blown what he didn't notice however was that the woman’s nose was twitching. Looking back up at her, his blood froze as her eyes snapped open. Green irises that seemed to shine in the darkness of the night, were the only noticeable feature he cared to take in, with baited breath he watched as her nose twitched again, and she lifted the pillow she was hugging to sniff it. Once, twice, she sniffed the pillow to identify his scent the sound somehow audible to him over the roar of his blood and the hammering of his heart.

Slowly she began to look around the room, he didn't dare move as she seemed to be searching as much by scent as she was by sight, suddenly her nose fell to the bed and she started to sniff like a bloodhound, he just resigned himself to his fate at that point. As he heard the sniffing of her nose get closer there was little for him to do till it stopped and she was staring directly at him. Looking up at her, she was wide-eyed, as she stared at him she seemed to go through several emotions at once; confusion, probably at what he was, anger, that something had invaded one of her most private places...compassion and a few more, finally she simply stared down at his shaking form, after a few moments more she made a move.

145111.content:
He watched as the wolf woman's mouth opened, admittedly he shrunk himself as much as he could as she leaned slightly closer, 'make it quick' he whimpered softly before shutting his eyes.

"Hello?" the word was more a question than an actual greeting, taking a moment to uncurl himself, he stared up at the wolf towering above him. Her green eyes staying focused on him "can you speak?" was the next thing out of her mouth. The fact that she was questioning rather than eating him was confusing him but he wasn't about to look a gift horse, wolf in the mouth.

"Y-yes?" he replied hesitantly, what surprised him was while she seemed surprised, she didn't seem freaked out, like things like this could or did happen on a daily basis.

She leaned over till her nose was almost touching him, a few small twitches of her letting him know she was smelling him "Hmm, you look like a human, you smell like a human, but I've never heard of any humans being so...small" her comment caught him off guard, the fact that there were other humans...where ever he was at the moment was a definite blessing. However that meant that he had somehow been shrunk by...whatever it was that had brought him here, either that or he was just tiny compared to the inhabitants of this world.

"I-I'm a human" he replied hesitantly, the wolf's eyebrow raising, whether due to the fact that he had started speaking of his own volition, or some other fact he wasn't sure.

Leaning over her voice changed, although she wasn't aggressive before, her tone became even softer a sympathetic tone characterizing it. "You're a pretty long way from Station Square, what happened to you?" she asked. Her eyes roamed over his body, whether to help her discern his intentions, or to keep him from lying he was unsure.

Sighing loudly enough for her to hear as he noticed her ears twitched slightly he decided there was no reason hiding anything, although eve if he convinced her that he was telling the truth, what would happen was completely outside of his sight. "To start, I'm not from Station Square, I've never even heard of the place, I don't think I'm even from this world, as I've never seen anything like you. I've seen wolves before, but never bipedal wolves that could talk" he said. Watching her eyes, she seemed curious when he mentioned that he was from another world but she made no attempt to interrupt him. "I know this must sound insane, but I'm telling the truth" he couldn't help but let a twinge of fear enter his voice, while the wolf woman didn't seem to want to hurt him, she was the only one who knew of his existence.

Slowly she sat back up, a finger tapping at her chin as she thought. Several moments pass before she speaks "I believe you" she said, relief washing over him as the two of them stared at each other. "Your explanation is strange, but stranger things have happened" she said, a small smile playing at the edge of her lips. Taking a moment to consider something she leaned over, drawing his attention to her lower body. As he watched her torso he missed two of her fingers moving behind him, only realizing they were there when they latched onto the back of his shirt. With a small yelp he was lifted off the bed, and to his surprise deposited into her right palm, lifting it up to her face he soon found himself eye to eye with the wolf woman.

"I just realized we haven't even intruded ourselves" she said, raising her left palm she placed it against her chest "I am Lupe Wolf, Grandchief of the Wolf Pack Nation, and you are?" she asked

"I'm Jacob Everson...that's about it" he replied, he knew it wasn't anything grand, but that was all he was, not really anything special. What he wasn't expecting was to see Lupe smile at him as she started to chuckle.

"Come now, I'm sure there is something extraordinary about you, something that sets you apart from others?" He could only shake his head in reply, this caused Lupe to frown. Sighing, and expecting to be put down he was surprised to feel one of Lupe's fingers gently press against his back and begin to gently stroke across his spine. "Facing down an unknown foe, many times your size isn't something worth speaking of?" she asked he simply shook his head again.

"You're not some monster or anything, and it wasn't like I was fighting you, we're just talking" he replied.

"You don't think that is some great act, although I dwarf you many times over you stared me in the eye. There is hesitance in your voice yet you stand tall and face me. Although you are in an unknown situation you haven't succumbed to fear, you are much stronger than you think" Lupe said. that small smile playing over her lips. He was honestly confused, he didn't understand why this was such a big deal.

"I...guess I am" he replied, the smile on her face growing larger.

"Now, what are we to do?" she asked him, "I do not wish to crush your hopes, but I will not lie to you, I know no way of returning you from whence you came, Princess Sally might, but currently many nations including hers are at war with a man named Ivo Robotnik, and I do not know even without the war that we could return you home." His entire demeanor crumbled under those words, potentially he'd never see home again, not only that but he was left several inches tall on an alien planet. The only reason that he was alive was Lupe's compassion.

Before he could really fall into depression he felt his body surrounded by warmth as Lupe gently pressed him against her cheek "it will be alright, I'll take care of you" she cooed softly. While her words were comforting they weren't enough as he felt warm tears start to trickle down his cheeks. He felt himself gently pressed against Lupe's cheek again, and taking the hint buried his face in her fur as he began to sob. All he heard as he cried was Lupe's gentle cooing and the warmth of her fur. After several minutes the tears dried and he pulled himself out of her fur, gently he was pulled in front of Lupe's face where she smiled sweetly down at him.

"I know this is not much, but you are welcome to stay with me as long as is necessary" she said softly.

"T-Thank you" he replied, while it might not have seemed like much to her, somewhere relatively safe in a world that would sooner see him as a bug than an intelligent being was a godsend. "If you'll just put me down, I'll leave you to get back to sleep" he said, not noticing the look Lupe was giving him. Rather than place him down on the bed however he was gently deposited on her pillow, before Lupe laid her head down right beside him. He was about to get up before her hand rested on top of him, the weight of her hand being little more than a heavy blanket, yet when he tried to get up she gently pushed him back into the pillow.

"You're sleeping with me" she replied matter of factly, a small yawn leaving her mouth. Taking a moment to get comfortable he watched her start to drift off. He felt tired but his body wouldn't let him rest, he had gone through a lot in the past several hours. Sighing he was about to gently push her hand off him when Lupe began to growl, it wasn't a bad growl, more like that contented growl dogs give off. Before he could move her fingers gently wrapped around him and he was hugged to her chest, her other hand draping over the one holding him. He began to struggle, obviously not wanting to wake up in a position like this but as he did he heard Lupe whine her grip around him tightening slightly.

Taking a moment to think he knew that he wasn't going to be getting out of this, resigning himself to being stuck he got as comfortable as he could, not noticing Lupe smiling, after several minutes he fell into a tumultuous yet dreamless sleep. When he wakes up....

"...so you were." Her grip had loosened on you (and you could breathe a bit more deeply), but her eyes still squinted with doubt at you and your story.

Did she believe you?

You awoke on a soft, but firm rubber surface; certainly a different experience compared to the smooth grass you were laying on before falling asleep. Getting your bearings, you sat yourself upright to better understand your surroundings.
Whatever surface you were on, it was flat and blue. It was longer than it was wide, and there were two thick straps above you, the same color as the surface and connecting to it on either side. This was completely alien to you. You couldn't even tell exactly where you were, though the most you could get her was that you were inside. Was there even anyone else here?

Then, as if on cue, you heard footsteps in the distance. Though, they seemed to be louder than they should be. You quickly saw what was causing he footsteps as it rounded a nearby corner; a wolf with jet-black hair, a blue outfit, and... it was walking on its two hind legs? It also appeared to be looking over a list that it was carrying, so it didn't notice you just yet. As this wolf came closer to you, you heard it speak in a powerful, but calm, feminine voice.
"There seems to be more to do today than previously expected... well, it seems now would be a good time to start early." You guessed that she was going out for the day, for reasons unknown to you.

She picked up from the floor a blue sandal with many straps and began putting it on, and was less than a foot away from you. Only when you noticed the color and shape of the sandal did you realize that you were on a sandal just like it! This worried you greatly, but there was not much that could be done. The giantess wolf has already finished putting on her left sandal and was in the process of putting on the right, which you were on. You had no time to escape as the wolf's toes slipped through the opening of the sandal, followed by the sole and the heel. The giant foot rapidly filled your field of vision before pressing you deep into the sandal with a great force. Although the sandal itself had some give, it still made for an uncomfortable experience, being trapped in between the wolf's paw pads and the firm sandal.

Did she notice you?
